meanings.sent1: She tends to misfocus on unimportant details.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes when I'm tired, I misfocus and make mistakes.
meanings.sent3: During the magic show, the magician would misfocus on purpose to confuse the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would misfocus like a camera lens in a dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The student's misfocus during the exam led to a lower grade than expected.

meanings.definition: The act of focusing incorrectly or inadequately.
meanings.sent1: His misfocus caused him to miss the important points of the presentation.
meanings.sent2: The misfocus of the camera made the picture blurry.
meanings.sent3: The misfocus of the telescope made the stars look like blobs.
meanings.sent4: Her misfocus on the task at hand resulted in a lot of wasted time.
meanings.sent5: The misfocus of the spotlight made it hard to see the performer on stage.
